headings: Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research Assistant
summary: IntroductionCirculation policies are essentially the same on all Miami University campuses. For specifics on library services offered at branch campuses please see the policies of theHamiltonandMiddle...
chunk_text: IntroductionCirculation policies are essentially the same on all Miami University campuses. For specifics on library services offered at branch campuses please see the policies of theHamiltonandMiddletownlibrariesCheck OutMiami University Students, Faculty, and Staff need a valid Miami ID with a barcode to borrow circulating materials. Other persons wishing to check out materials should contact the King Library Circulation Desk for information at (513) 529-4141.Borrowers not affiliated with the University may obtain anAffiliated Patrons of the Librariescard by completing an application during business hours Monday - Friday in the Dean's Office (225 King Library) and by contributing $25 tax-deductible donation cash or check annually.

chunk_text: This card doesNOTprovide off-site access to library databases.Please note:Due to necessary restrictions in light of the covid-19 pandemic, we are currently unable to accept applications for new affiliated patrons. Existing affiliated patrons' membership has been extended through the end of the fall semester.Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research AssistantFaculty Authorization FormSubmit this form to King Library Circulation to grant a research assistant permission to check out items on your behalf.The form may be filled in online but must be printed and signed by both parties and include their Banner+ numbers.

title: Circulation Policies: Loan Periods, Fines and Charges (Miami University Items)
headings: Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research Assistant
summary: Faculty are responsible for all materials checked out by the person designated, and are responsible for timely returns and renewals.Check-InItems can be returned to any library. Book drops on the Oxfo...
chunk_text: Faculty are responsible for all materials checked out by the person designated, and are responsible for timely returns and renewals.Check-InItems can be returned to any library. Book drops on the Oxford Campus are also located in the Shriver Center and in Alexander Dining Hall.REMINDER:Patrons are responsible for all items on their account. A list of books checked out can be viewed (and renewed) on theCheckouts & Renewalspage available on the Libraries' web site. Overdue notices are provided as a courtesy; non-receipt of an overdue message does not exempt patrons from finesLoan PeriodsMiami University BooksUndergraduate Students - 3 WeeksGraduate Students - 1 SemesterFaculty - 1 YearOther Patrons - 3 WeeksLibrary materials are a shared resource.

title: Circulation Policies: Loan Periods, Fines and Charges (Miami University Items)
headings: Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research Assistant
summary: All items may be recalled after a minimum three week loan period if another Miami University patron requests them. Items needed for course reserve will be recalled immediatelyIMC CollectionsAll studen...
chunk_text: All items may be recalled after a minimum three week loan period if another Miami University patron requests them. Items needed for course reserve will be recalled immediatelyIMC CollectionsAll students and faculty - 3 weeksReservesLoan periods for Reserve Items vary from 2 hours to 7 days.

title: Circulation Policies: Loan Periods, Fines and Charges (Miami University Items)
headings: Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research Assistant
summary: See the sectionReserve Itemsfor details.JournalsGraduate students and faculty may check out journal issues/volumes for 24 hours with approval from the Reference Librarian on duty.RenewalsItems from th...
chunk_text: See the sectionReserve Itemsfor details.JournalsGraduate students and faculty may check out journal issues/volumes for 24 hours with approval from the Reference Librarian on duty.RenewalsItems from the circulating collection may be renewed unless another patron has placed a request for that item.Overdue FeesBooks - $.50 per day to a maximum of $15.00.IMC Videos - $2.50 per day up to a maximum of $15.00 per video.Reserve Items - $2.50 for the first hour overdue and $.75 per additional hour, to a maximum of $24.25 per item.Recalled Materials - $.75 per day to a maximum of $24.25 per item.Electronic Equipment (e.g., laptop computers): $5 per hour to a maximum of $100.Contactlibfines@miamioh.edufor help.Replacement CostsBooks - The replacement cost for lost material is $70.00 per item, plus a $30.00 cataloging and processing fee.

title: Circulation Policies: Loan Periods, Fines and Charges (Miami University Items)
headings: Faculty Authorization for Library Use by Research Assistant
summary: Any overdue fines will also be added. Replacement charges cannot be refunded for items more than one year overdueElectronic Equipment - $2,000 per laptop, $495 per digital camera, and actual cost for ...
chunk_text: Any overdue fines will also be added. Replacement charges cannot be refunded for items more than one year overdueElectronic Equipment - $2,000 per laptop, $495 per digital camera, and actual cost for accessories.Repair Charges - Charges to repair damaged or mutilated library materials or equipment will reflect actual repair costs. IntroductionCirculation policies are essentially the same on all Miami University campuses. For specifics on library services offered at branch campuses please see the policies of theHamiltonandMiddletownlibrariesCheck OutMiami University Students, Faculty, and Staff need a valid Miami ID with a barcode to borrow circulating materials.

chunk_text: Faculty are responsible for all materials checked out by the person designated, and are responsible for timely returns and renewals. Check-InItems can be returned to any library. Book drops on the Oxford Campus are also located in the Shriver Center and in Alexander Dining Hall.REMINDER:Patrons are responsible for all items on their account. A list of books checked out can be viewed (and renewed) on theCheckouts & Renewalspage available on the Libraries' web site. Overdue notices are provided as a courtesy; non-receipt of an overdue message does not exempt patrons from fines Check-InItems can be returned to any library. Book drops on the Oxford Campus are also located in the Shriver Center and in Alexander Dining Hall.REMINDER:Patrons are responsible for all items on their account.

chunk_text: Overdue notices are provided as a courtesy; non-receipt of an overdue message does not exempt patrons from fines.InterLibrary Loan MaterialsInterlibrary loan (ILL) is available only for current Miami University students, faculty, and staff.Loan periods for items received by the Miami University Libraries are determined by the owning institution. Although there are no per diem overdue charges, the owning institution may issue Miami University a non-refundable bill for replacement charges for items kept past the due date/loan period or lost.

title: Circulation Policies: Loan Periods, Fines and Charges (OhioLINK & ILL)
headings: Fines for OhioLINK materials are set by a coordinating committee of the members' librarians.
summary: InterLibrary Loan MaterialsInterlibrary loan (ILL) is available only for current Miami University students, faculty, and staff.Loan periods for items received by the Miami University Libraries are det...
chunk_text: InterLibrary Loan MaterialsInterlibrary loan (ILL) is available only for current Miami University students, faculty, and staff.Loan periods for items received by the Miami University Libraries are determined by the owning institution. Although there are no per diem overdue charges, the owning institution may issue Miami University a non-refundable bill for replacement charges for items kept past the due date/loan period or lost. The full amount of this bill will be passed on to the patron, and his/her interlibrary loan and Miami University Libraries accounts may be blocked until the bill is paid.Renewals are at the discretion of the lending institution, and are rarely granted once an item becomes overdue.

title: Circulation Policies: Recalling / Requesting Miami U Books
summary: Holds & RecallsAll patrons are entitled to use checked out items for at least 21 days unless they have been recalled for use as Reserve Readings.Before recalling an item, please check theOhioLINK cata...
chunk_text: Holds & RecallsAll patrons are entitled to use checked out items for at least 21 days unless they have been recalled for use as Reserve Readings.Before recalling an item, please check theOhioLINK catalogto see if another copy is available elsewhere in the state.You may place a recall request through the catalog by clicking on theRequest Item.Aholdmay be placed on items due in less than 21 days. After the item has been returned and checked in, a notice will be generated and e-mailed to you indicating that the item is available for pickup.Books will remain on the hold shelf for 10 days before a hold expires. Videos will remain for four days.

title: Circulation Policies: Recalling / Requesting Miami U Books
summary: Books on hold shelf cannot be checked out by another patron before the hold expires.Southwest Ohio Regional Depository (SWORD)The Southwest Ohio Regional Depository (SWORD) is a remote storage facilit...
chunk_text: Books on hold shelf cannot be checked out by another patron before the hold expires.Southwest Ohio Regional Depository (SWORD)The Southwest Ohio Regional Depository (SWORD) is a remote storage facility that houses less frequently used library materials. Requests for books and complete journal volumes may be placed online. Once you have located the item you need in the Libraries' catalog, select theRequest Itemlink and follow instructions. Please allow 2-3 business days to receive the requested item. Materials will be sent to the library location that you designate at the time of the request.Copies of articles from journals housed in the Southwest Depository can also be requested.

title: Circulation Policies: Recalling / Requesting Miami U Books
summary: Locate the journal title you need in the MiamiLINK catalog, select theRequest Itemlink, then selectArticle from S.W. Depository.Complete all the information about the journal article on the online for...
chunk_text: Locate the journal title you need in the MiamiLINK catalog, select theRequest Itemlink, then selectArticle from S.W. Depository.Complete all the information about the journal article on the online form. As with other materials requested from SWORD, please allow 2-3 business days. You will receive a URL at which you can obtain the item you requested, or the item may be sent to the library location that you designate at the time of the request.

title: Circulation Policies: Requesting Books from Other Sites

chunk_text: Requesting Books from OhioLinkItems not currently available may be requested through the OhioLINK catalog, which will display the combined holdings of all OhioLINK institutions. Provided that the item is inAVAILABLEstatus at another OhioLINK institution, theRequest Itemlink will enable you to request a book or other circulating item. title: Reserves and Textbooks: Course Materials on Reserve
headings: What to Place on Course Reserves
How to Place Materials on Reserve
summary: What to Place on Course ReservesLibrary Books and DVDs - Library staff will retrieve library materials for you and place them on reserve. Please include author, title and call number to facilitate tim...
chunk_text: What to Place on Course ReservesLibrary Books and DVDs - Library staff will retrieve library materials for you and place them on reserve. Please include author, title and call number to facilitate timely processing. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot place on reserve OhioLINK books and DVDs, books and DVDs borrowed via Interlibrary Loan, or entire issues or volumes of library periodicals.Personally Owned Books -We will affix a barcode, reserve labels, and theft detection devices to personal copies provided to us for reserve. Personal materials are returned to you through campus mail unless otherwise indicated. The library is not responsible for the loss of, or damage to, personal copies.Individual Chapters - Chapters or selections from a single book or monograph may be placed on course reserve.

headings: What to Place on Course Reserves

summary: Copyright guidelines limit copying to one chapter, or not more than 10% of a work. We can place one copy for every 20 students in a class, to a maximum of three copies.How to Place Materials on Reserv...
chunk_text: Copyright guidelines limit copying to one chapter, or not more than 10% of a work. We can place one copy for every 20 students in a class, to a maximum of three copies.How to Place Materials on ReserveFill out a Reserve Request Form and deliver materials to be placed on reserve to a Circulation desk for processing.You may use ourweb-based requestform, or downloadthis documentand fill it out using Adobe Acrobat. Once completed, send the PDF to the appropriate email address:King Library:kingreserves@miamioh.eduArt & Architecture Library:aareserves@miamioh.eduThe week before and the first week of Fall and Spring semesters are busy times.

Options are 2 hour checkouts (For Use in the Library only); 1-day or 3-daysDuration of Reserve MaterialsAll reserves materials are removed at the end of every semester. Library material is returned to the circulating collection.Search Course Reserves & Available TextbooksSearch available textbooksSearch suggestions: Type the title of the textbook, the course abbreviation (i.e., ECO 201) , or the professor's last name into the search field.

headings: What to Place on Course Reserves
How to Place Materials on Reserve
summary: The library is not responsible for the loss of, or damage to, personal copies.Individual Chapters - Chapters or selections from a single book or monograph may be placed on course reserve. Copyright gu...
chunk_text: The library is not responsible for the loss of, or damage to, personal copies.Individual Chapters - Chapters or selections from a single book or monograph may be placed on course reserve. Copyright guidelines limit copying to one chapter, or not more than 10% of a work. We can place one copy for every 20 students in a class, to a maximum of three copies. Library Books and DVDs - Library staff will retrieve library materials for you and place them on reserve. Please include author, title and call number to facilitate timely processing. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot place on reserve OhioLINK books and DVDs, books and DVDs borrowed via Interlibrary Loan, or entire issues or volumes of library periodicals.

title: Reserves and Textbooks: Course Materials on Reserve
headings: What to Place on Course Reserves
How to Place Materials on Reserve
summary: Personally Owned Books -We will affix a barcode, reserve labels, and theft detection devices to personal copies provided to us for reserve. Personal materials are returned to you through campus mail u...
chunk_text: Personally Owned Books -We will affix a barcode, reserve labels, and theft detection devices to personal copies provided to us for reserve. Personal materials are returned to you through campus mail unless otherwise indicated. The library is not responsible for the loss of, or damage to, personal copies. Individual Chapters - Chapters or selections from a single book or monograph may be placed on course reserve. Copyright guidelines limit copying to one chapter, or not more than 10% of a work. We can place one copy for every 20 students in a class, to a maximum of three copies.

At other times, please allow 2 working days.

title: Circulation Policies: Affiliated Patrons
headings: Affiliated Patrons of the Libraries Privileges and Policies
summary: Affiliated Patrons of the Libraries Privileges and PoliciesMiami University Libraries Materials:A limit of 20 items may be checked out to an individual at one time.(This includes OhioLINK items.)The n...
chunk_text: Affiliated Patrons of the Libraries Privileges and PoliciesMiami University Libraries Materials:A limit of 20 items may be checked out to an individual at one time.(This includes OhioLINK items.)The normal checkout period for most books is 3 weeks.Most items can be renewed.Overdue fines for Miami University books are 50 cents per day to a maximum of $15.00.Replacement charges for lost Miami University items are $115.00 per item ($70.00 replacement fee, $30.00 processing fee, and a $15.00 billing fee).Miami University Electronic Resources:All online databases, indexes, and other electronic resources are available on campus ONLY.OhioLINK Materials:A maximum of 5 OhioLINK items may be in use at one time.OhioLINK books have a 21-day loan period and can be renewed up to times as long as another patron has not placed a hold on it.•OhioLINK media materials (videos, tapes, CD’s, DVD’s, etc.) typically have a 7-day loan period and cannot be renewed.Overdue fines for OhioLINK materials are 50 cents per day for the first 30 days.
